urlfetch.UrlFetchApp.name: UrlFetchApp
urlfetch.UrlFetchApp.doc: UrlFetchApp Fetch resources and communicate with other hosts over the Internet. This service allows scripts to communicate with other applications or access other resources on the web by fetching URLs. A script can use the URL Fetch service to issue HTTP and HTTPS requests and receive responses. The URL Fetch service uses Google's network infrastructure for efficiency and scaling purposes. See also OAuthConfig HTTPResponse

method.name: addOAuthService
method.doc: Registers the given service name with the OAuth configuration and returns the newly created OAuthConfig object for an OAuth service with the given name.

argument.name: serviceName
argument.doc: identifier for the service; used for the oAuthServiceName field in calls to fetch(url, params)

method.name: fetch
method.doc: Makes a request to fetch a URL.

method.name: fetch
method.doc: Makes a request to fetch a URL using optional advanced parameters.

argument.name: params
argument.doc: optional JavaScript object specifying advanced parameters as defined below

method.name: getRequest
method.doc: Returns the request that would be made if the operation was invoked.

method.name: getRequest
method.doc: Returns the request that would be made if the operation were invoked.

argument.name: params
argument.doc: optional JavaScript object specifying advanced parameters as defined below

method.name: removeOAuthService
method.doc: Removes the OAuthConfig for the given service name.

urlfetch.HTTPResponse.name: HTTPResponse
urlfetch.HTTPResponse.doc: HTTPResponse This class allows users to access specific information on HTTP responses. See also UrlFetchApp

method.name: getAllHeaders
method.doc: Returns an attribute/value map of headers for the HTTP response, with headers that have multiple values returned as arrays.

method.name: getAs
method.doc: Return the data inside this object as a blob converted to the specified content type.

argument.name: contentType
argument.doc: the MIME type to convert to. For most blobs, 'application/pdf' is the only valid option. For images in BMP, GIF, JPEG, or PNG format, any of 'image/bmp', 'image/gif', 'image/jpeg', or 'image/png' are also valid.

method.name: getBlob
method.doc: Return the data inside this object as a blob.

method.name: getContent
method.doc: Gets the raw binary content of an HTTP response.

method.name: getContentText
method.doc: Gets the content of an HTTP response encoded as a string.

method.name: getContentText
method.doc: Returns the content of an HTTP response encoded as a string of the given charset.

argument.name: charset
argument.doc: a string representing the charset to be used for encoding the HTTP response content

method.name: getHeaders
method.doc: Returns an attribute/value map of headers for the HTTP response.

method.name: getResponseCode
method.doc: Get the HTTP status code (200 for OK, etc.) of an HTTP response.

urlfetch.OAuthConfig.name: OAuthConfig
urlfetch.OAuthConfig.doc: OAuthConfig Represents configuration settings for an OAuth-enabled remote service. See also UrlFetchApp

method.name: getAccessTokenUrl
method.doc: Returns the URL used to get the access token from.

method.name: getAuthorizationUrl
method.doc: Returns the authorization URL.

method.name: getMethod
method.doc: Returns the HTTP method used to complete the OAuth protocol.

method.name: getParamLocation
method.doc: Returns the location of the parameters in the request when retreiving the request token.

method.name: getRequestTokenUrl
method.doc: Returns the URL used to get the request token.

method.name: getServiceName
method.doc: Returns the name used to reference this service.

method.name: setAccessTokenUrl
method.doc: Sets the URL to get an OAuth access token from.

argument.name: url
argument.doc: the URL given by the OAuth service provider for obtaining an access token

method.name: setAuthorizationUrl
method.doc: Sets the URL for the OAuth authorization service.

argument.name: url
argument.doc: the URL given by the OAuth service provider for authorizing a token

method.name: setConsumerKey
method.doc: Sets the consumer key (provided when you register with an OAuth service).

argument.name: consumerKey
argument.doc: the consumer key provided by the OAuth service provider. Be sure to use UserProperties, to avoid exposing your key in your script's source code.

method.name: setConsumerSecret
method.doc: Sets the consumer secret (provided when you register with an OAuth service).

argument.name: consumerSecret
argument.doc: the consumer secret provided by the OAuth service provider. Be sure to use UserProperties, to avoid exposing your secret in your script's source code.

method.name: setMethod
method.doc: Sets the HTTP method used to complete the OAuth protocol.

argument.name: method
argument.doc: the method to be used with this service

method.name: setParamLocation
method.doc: Sets the parameter location in OAuth protocol requests.

argument.name: location
argument.doc: the location for the OAuth request. Allowed values are 'post-body', 'uri-query' and 'auth-header'.

method.name: setRequestTokenUrl
method.doc: Sets the request URL for the OAuth service.

argument.name: url
argument.doc: the URL given by the OAuth service provider for obtaining request token
